Welcome to the Joshua Nations Year 1 Curriculum!

Contents

Unit 1: DOCTRINE(Part 1)

  • Lesson 1: Bible Doctrine
    • I. WHAT IS DOCTRINE?
    • II. WHY IS THE STUDY OF DOCTRINE IMPORTANT?
    • III. THE BIBLE AS THE FOUNDATION FOR BIBLE DOCTRINE
    • Twelve Application Questions about the text: 2 Tim 3:16-17
  • Lesson 2: Doctrine of God
    • I. GOD THE FATHER: “God is a spirit, infinite, eternal, and unchangeable in His being, wisdom, power, holiness, justice, and truth” (Westminster Catechism).
      • A. Source of revelation: How has God revealed himself?
      • B. The Non-Moral Attributes of God (attributes that humans do not possess at any level)
      • C. The Moral Attributes of God (attributes humans possess with God to a point)
      • D. The Character of God is Revealed Through His Names
      • E. The names of God are revelatory instruments of His status, His character, and His vocation.
      • F. The Seven Redemptive Names of God (These names reveal the blessings provided by the atonement).
      • G. Other Names of God
  • Lesson 3: Doctrine of God the Son
    • I. GOD THE SON: THE LORD JESUS CHRIST
      • A. The Son of God is Unique.
      • B. The “Word” is another title for Jesus (John 1:1-3,14).
      • C. Son of Man.
      • D. FALSE views about the nature of Christ.
      • E. ORTHODOX view of the nature of Christ (the true view).
      • F. The Offices of Christ – The Anointed One (Isa. 6:1, 11:1-3)
      • G. Jesus Christ the Lamb of God
      • H. Jesus Christ the Healer
      • I. The Present and Future Ministry of Jesus Christ
  • Lesson 4: Doctrine of God the Spirit and the Holy Trinity
    • I. GOD THE HOLY SPIRIT
      • A. The Person of the Holy Spirit
      • B. He is as God (Acts 5:3-4; Jn. 4:24)
      • C. He is the third member of the Triune Godhead (Trinity)
      • D. He comes from God the Father (Acts 2:33)
      • E. He has divine perfections:
      • F. He has personality traits:
      • G. He acts as a person.
      • H. Symbols, Characteristics, and Facts about the Holy Spirit
    • II. THE TRINITY (FATHER, SON, AND HOLY SPIRIT)
      • A. They are referred to as God.
      • B. They have a Relationship with each other and they honor each other.
      • C. The Doctrine of the Trinity as seen in the Old Testament
      • D. The doctrine of the Trinity as seen in the New Testament
  • Lesson 5: The Holy Spirit and the Life of a Believer
    • I. THE HOLY SPIRIT’S WORK IN THE OLD AND NEW TESTAMENTS
      • A. The Holy Spirit in the Old Testament
      • B. The Holy Spirit in the New Testament
      • C. The Holy Spirit in the life of the believer
      • D. The Holy Spirit releases the Gifts of the Spirit for the life of the believer.

  • Lesson 7: Man and Sin
